verbose_text: Lastly, the GIP (gastric inhibitory polypeptide, also known as the glucose dependent insulinotropic polypeptide) gene has a known effect on stimulating the release of insulin from pancreatic beta cells, but also has an insulin like effect on adipocytes, suggesting that the GIP gene product enhances adipocyte glucose uptake, and that, at least in humans, it has an important role in the development of nutrition induced obesity [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: GIP (gastric inhibitory polypeptide, also known as the glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide) gene has a known effect on stimulating the release of insulin from pancreatic beta cells, but also has an insulin-like effect on adipocytes, suggesting that the GIP gene product enhances adipocyte glucose
